sentences.en: As there was already pre-charge applied to the electroscope , an additional little charge caused reaction.
sentences.cn: 由于已经有预充电适用于验电器，额外收取很少引起的反应。

sentences.en: Figure 4 - 2 a present - day laboratory version of the electroscope.
sentences.cn: 图 4-2 就是目前实验室里的验电器样式.

sentences.en: Figure 4 - 2 shows a present - day laboratory version of the electroscope.
sentences.cn: 图4 - 2就是目前实验室里的验电器样式.

sentences.en: Her electroscope was a metal case with two holes in its side.
sentences.cn: 她的验电器是一个金属盒子，旁边有两个小孔。

sentences.en: In today's experiment you are going to build an electroscope to measure the static electricity of various household objects.
sentences.cn: 今天的实验中，你会自己做一个验电器，来测量看看不同的家用品各会产生多少静电。

sentences.en: It was an electroscope which contained a small amount of radium.
sentences.cn: 这是一个验电器，其中载有少量的镭。

sentences.en: Step 3 : If the aluminum foil ball is repelled away from the dish, the electroscope works.
sentences.cn: 步骤 三: 如果这颗铝箔球和锡箔烤盘彼此排斥,就表示你的验电器成功了.

sentences.en: The leaves of the electroscope slowly diverge.
sentences.cn: 验电器的叶片慢慢张开.

trans.tran_en: an apparatus for detecting an electric charge, typically consisting of a rod holding two gold foils that separate when a charge is applied
